label: Barn Swallow
description: A small, agile bird often seen near farms and open fields across Switzerland in summer. Known for its distinctive forked tail and blue-black coloring. Does not carry significant avian diseases.

label: Blackbird
description: A common garden bird found in gardens and woodlands throughout Switzerland. Males are all black, while females are brown with speckled breasts. Does not carry significant avian diseases.

label: Chicken
description: Domesticated fowl commonly kept for its eggs and meat. Chickens can be found on farms across Switzerland. Can carry avian diseases such as H5N1, H5N2, H7N2, and H7N8.

label: Common Chaffinch
description: A small passerine bird often seen in woodlands and gardens throughout Switzerland. Males have a bright pink chest and blue-grey wings. Does not carry significant avian diseases.

label: Duck
description: A waterfowl commonly seen in wetlands, lakes, and rivers in Switzerland. Ducks have a varied diet and are often observed in urban parks. Can carry avian diseases such as H5N1, H5N2, and H7N8.

label: Eurasian Blue Tit
description: A small, colorful bird found in woodlands and gardens throughout Switzerland. It has a blue cap, yellow underparts, and a distinctive black line through its eye. Does not carry significant avian diseases.

label: Eurasian Magpie
description: A highly intelligent bird known for its black-and-white plumage and long tail. Common in a variety of habitats, including urban and rural areas throughout Switzerland. Does not carry significant avian diseases.

label: European Robin
description: A small bird with a bright orange-red breast, commonly found in gardens and woodlands throughout Switzerland. Does not carry significant avian diseases.

label: Goose
description: Large waterfowl typically seen in wetlands, lakes, and fields in Switzerland. Geese are migratory and can be found in both rural and urban areas. Does not carry significant avian diseases.

label: Great Tit
description: A robust bird with a black head and white cheeks, commonly found in forests, parks, and gardens throughout Switzerland. Does not carry significant avian diseases.

label: House Sparrow
description: A small bird commonly found in urban and rural areas throughout Switzerland. Males have a distinctive chestnut-colored back and black throat. Does not carry significant avian diseases.

label: Turkey
description: Large domesticated bird often seen on farms in Switzerland. Native to North America but commonly kept in rural areas. Does not carry significant avian diseases.
